intro: Rhytiglossa menthoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mintweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
